SEARCH
Package com.paradegame.model

Class GameState

java.lang.Object
com.paradegame.model.GameState
public class GameState extends Object
Represents the state of the Parade game.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • GameState

      public GameState(List<Player> players)
      Constructs a new game state with the given players. Initialises the deck, parade, deals initial hands to players and sets the first player.
      Parameters:
      players - The list of players participating in the game.

  • Method Details

    • isLastRound

      public boolean isLastRound()
      Checks if the game is in the last round.
      Returns:
      true if the game is in the last round, otherwise false.

    • checkLastRound

      public void checkLastRound()
      Checks if the last round should begin (all colors collected, deck empty, or already triggered). Increments the lastRoundIndex and sets the lastRound flag if the conditions are met.

    • getlastRoundIndex

      public int getlastRoundIndex()
      Gets the index of the last round.
      Returns:
      The index representing the last round state.

    • isDiscardPhase

      public boolean isDiscardPhase()
      Determines if the current player is in the discard phase based on the number of cards in their hand.
      Returns:
      true if the current player is in the discard phase, otherwise false.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Determines if the game is over. The game ends when the last round has been reached, which occurs after every player has taken their turn in the final round.
      Returns:
      true if the game has ended, otherwise false.

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn()
      Moves the game to the next turn by updating the current player index.

    • calculateScores

      public Map<Player,Integer> calculateScores()
      Calculates the scores for all players at the end of the game. Scores are determined based on the collected cards of each player. Players with the majority in a colour flip those cards, making each worth 1 point. In a 2-player game, a majority requires at least a 2-card lead. Scores are the sum of all collected card values.
      Returns:
      A map of players and their corresponding scores.

    • getPlayers

      public List<Player> getPlayers()
      Gets the list of players in the game.
      Returns:
      The list of players.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the current player whose turn it is.
      Returns:
      The current player.

    • getDeck

      public Deck getDeck()
      Gets the deck of cards in the game.
      Returns:
      The deck of cards.

    • getParade

      public Parade getParade()
      Gets the parade of cards in the game.
      Returns:
      The parade instance.
